basics.name: Watcharapong Wongkaew
basics.label: Transportation Engineer
basics.summary: An aspiring transportation engineer with a passion for sustainable transportation and urban planning with a bachelor in civil engineering from Chulalongkorn University.

work.name: Chulalongkorn University Transportation Institute
work.summary: Research Associate at Chulalongkorn University Transportation Institute (CUTI) with a focus on transportation engineering and urban planning.

work.name: Advanced Railway Infrastructure, Innovation and Systems Engineering Research Unit
work.summary: Researcher at Advanced Railway Infrastructure, Innovation and Systems Engineering Research Unit (ARIISE) with a focus on railway engineering and climate resilient.
highlights: Developed a new method for predicting the flood risk

work.name: Pheu Thai Party
work.summary: Researcher at Pheu Thai Party with a focus on transportation policy and urban planning.

volunteer.summary: PR Lead at Environmental Conservation Club with a focus on sustainable development.
highlights: Co-organize PR event for the club

awards.title: First Class Honors
awards.summary: First class honors in Bachelor of Engineering in Transportation Engineering.

awards.title: Research Apprenticeship
awards.summary: Awarded for research apprenticeship at Chulalongkorn University Transportation Institute.

certificates.name: Bayesian Statistics: From Concept to Data Analysis

publications.name: Data driven machine learning prognostics of buckling failure modes in ballasted railway track
publications.summary: This study explores the development and application of a machine learning (ML) approach to predict buckling failure modes in ballasted railway tracks.

references.name: Professor Saksith Chalermpong
references.reference: One of his standout contributions was his innovative work on the Bangkok Travel Demand survey, where he authored a creative paper predicting mode choice using machine learning methods

references.name: Assistant Professor Pongsun Bunditsakulchai
references.reference: His time during research project entitled “Development of a Time-Specific 4-Step Sequential Model for Examining Travel Behavior in Nakhon Ratchasima” is what truly sets him apart. His capacity to not only comprehend intricate theories but also to apply them in ways that redefine boundaries within travel behavior survey and analysis.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
